032package org.opengis.test;
033
034import java.util.Locale;
035import java.util.Collection;
036import org.opengis.util.Factory;
037import org.opengis.util.InternationalString;
038import org.opengis.metadata.citation.Citation;
039import org.opengis.referencing.AuthorityFactory;
040
041
042/**
043 * Specifies whether a factory can be used for creating the objects to be tested.
044 * Implementors can provide an instance of this interface in their test packages and
045 * declare their instance in the {@code META-INF/services/org.opengis.test.FactoryFilter}
046 * file. GeoAPI will iterate over every {@code FactoryFilter}s found on the classpath before
047 * the first execution of any particular {@link TestCase} subclass, in order to check
048 * whether a particular factory can be used.
049 *
050 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
051 * @version 3.1
052 * @since   3.1
053 */
054public interface FactoryFilter {
055    /**
056     * Returns {@code true} if the given factory can be tested. Implementors shall return
057     * {@code false} only when they really want to exclude a particular factory. For every
058     * unknown factory, this method shall return {@code true}.
059     *
060     * <p>If more than one {@code FactoryFilter} is found on the classpath, then the given factory
061     * will be tested only if all {@code FactoryFilter.filter(â€¦)} calls returned {@code true}.</p>
062     *
063     * @param  <T>       the compile-time type of the {@code category} argument.
064     * @param  category  the factory interface ({@link org.opengis.util.NameFactory},
065     *                   {@link org.opengis.referencing.crs.CRSFactory}, <i>etc.</i>).
066     * @param  factory   the factory instance.
067     * @return {@code false} if the given factory should be excluded from the tests,
068     *         or {@code true} otherwise.
069     */
070    <T extends Factory> boolean filter(Class<T> category, T factory);
071
072
073
074
075    /**
076     * Filters {@link AuthorityFactory} by their {@linkplain AuthorityFactory#getAuthority()
077     * authority name}. This filter accepts any factory meeting at least one of the following
078     * conditions:
079     *
080     * <ul>
081     *   <li>The factory is not an instance of {@link AuthorityFactory}.</li>
082     *   <li>The {@linkplain AuthorityFactory#getAuthority() authority} citation has a
083     *       {@linkplain Citation#getTitle title} or {@linkplain Citation#getAlternateTitles
084     *       alternate title} matching the name given to this filter at construction time.</li>
085     * </ul>
086     *
087     * The string comparisons are case-insensitive and ignore leading and trailing spaces.
088     *
089     * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
090     * @version 3.1
091     * @since   3.1
092     */
093    public static class ByAuthority implements FactoryFilter {
094        /**
095         * Convenience constant for a frequently used factory filter.
096         */
097        public static final FactoryFilter EPSG = new ByAuthority("EPSG");
098
099        /**
100         * The authority names (typically {@code "EPSG"}).
101         */
102        private final String[] names;
103
104        /**
105         * Creates a new filter for the given authority names.
106         *
107         * @param names  the authority names (typically {@code "EPSG"}).
108         */
109        public ByAuthority(String... names) {
110            this.names = names = names.clone();
111            for (int i=0; i<names.length; i++) {
112                names[i] = names[i].trim();
113            }
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Returns {@code true} if the given {@link InternationalString} is equals to the
118         * {@link #name}. Only the US locale and the default locale string are compared.
119         */
120        private boolean isValid(final InternationalString i18n) {
121            if (i18n == null) {
122                return false;
123            }
124            for (final String name : names) {
125                final String asString = i18n.toString(Locale.US);
126                if (asString.trim().equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
127                    return true;
128                }
129                final String asLocalized = i18n.toString();
130                if (asLocalized != asString && asLocalized.trim().equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
131                    return true;
132                }
133            }
134            return false;
135        }
136
137        /**
138         * Returns {@code true}, unless the given factory is an instance of {@link AuthorityFactory}
139         * and the authority name is not the expected one. See class-javadoc for more details.
140         */
141        @Override
142        public <T extends Factory> boolean filter(final Class<T> category, final T factory) {
143            if (!AuthorityFactory.class.isAssignableFrom(category)) {
144                return true;
145            }
146            final Citation authority = ((AuthorityFactory) factory).getAuthority();
147            if (authority != null) {
148                if (isValid(authority.getTitle())) {
149                    return true;
150                }
151                final Collection<? extends InternationalString> titles = authority.getAlternateTitles();
152                if (titles != null) {
153                    for (final InternationalString candidate : titles) {
154                        if (isValid(candidate)) {
155                            return true;
156                        }
157                    }
158                }
159            }
160            return false;
161        }
162    }
163}
